title: Purpose
context: RECOVERY OF MONEY OWED TO THE STATE §231-51 Purpose. The purpose of sections 231-52 to 231-59 is to permit the retention of state income tax refunds of those persons who owe a debt to the State, who are delinquent in the payment of child support pursuant to section 576D-1, who have defaulted on an education loan note held by the United Student Aid Funds, Inc., who owe federal income taxes to the United States Treasurer, or who receive a medicaid overpayment subject to recovery under section 346-59.6. [L 1982, c 199, pt of §1; am L 1985, c 256, §1; am L 1986, c 87, §1; am L 1988, c 199, §1; am L 1998, c 153, §1 and c 293, §3] Cross References Civil relief for state military forces, see chapter 657D.
